intro: Prasophyllum calopterum, commonly known as the broad-leaved leek orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southeastern Australia. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features a rosette of broad, grass-like leaves and produces spikes of pale green to yellowish flowers. It is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. Prasophyllum calopterum is often found in coastal and tableland regions, where it thrives in mild, temperate climates.
